ai.summary: Greenbrae is a short, easy 2.4 km hike in the UK, suitable for beginners and families. The route offers gentle terrain and calm countryside views, making it a quick outdoor escape.
ai.terrain_summary: The trail is mostly flat to gently rolling, with a mix of gravel and compact paths, plus gentle grassy sections near the edges. Elevation gain is minimal, and the route is generally well-marked.
ai.safety_notes: - Check the forecast and daylight hours before you go. - Wear sturdy, comfortable footwear and dress for changeable UK weather. - Carry a light water bottle and a small snack. - Stay on marked paths; watch for slippery surfaces when wet. - Keep children and dogs under control and respect wildlife. - Have a charged phone and a basic map or GPS, and know your planned turnaround time.
recommended_gear: Water bottle (1–2 liters depending on conditions)
Light waterproof jacket and extra layer
Map, phone with offline navigation, or small compass
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn when daylight and weather are generally favorable; the trail is also walkable in winter with appropriate gear.

seo.title: Greenbrae: Easy 2.4 km Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Discover Greenbrae, a 2.4 km easy hike in the UK suitable for beginners. Learn about terrain, safety tips, gear, best seasons, and more.
